description.raw:
I'm working on some new tutorials for sdformat, and I thought it would be helpful to create an example command-line utility for converting between the Euler angles used in the latter half of the `<pose>` tag and a Quaternion or Rotation matrix. This adds the following two standalone example programs:

* `quaternion_from_euler`: takes 3 floating point arguments (`roll`, `pitch`, `yaw` angles in radians) from the command line and prints out the equivalent angles in degrees and the equivalent quaternion and rotation matrix.
* `quaternion_to_euler`: takes 4 floating point arguments (`w`, `x`, `y`, `z`) from the command line and prints out the normalized quaternion components, the equivalent roll/pitch/yaw in radians and degrees, and the equivalent rotation matrix.

~~~
$ ./quaternion_from_euler -2.36 0 0
Converting Euler angles:
 roll  -2.360000 radians
 pitch  0.000000 radians
 yaw    0.000000 radians

 roll   -135.218040 degrees
 pitch     0.000000 degrees
 yaw       0.000000 degrees

to Quaternion
 W  0.380925
 X -0.924606
 Y  0.000000
 Z  0.000000

to Rotation matrix
    1.000000  -0.000000   0.000000
    0.000000  -0.709793   0.704411
   -0.000000  -0.704411  -0.709793
~~~

~~~
$ ./quaternion_to_euler 0 0 3 4
Normalizing Quaternion components:
  W 0
  X 0
  Y 3
  Z 4
to
  W 0
  X 0
  Y 0.6
  Z 0.8

Converting to Euler angles
 roll   1.287002 radians
 pitch -0.000000 radians
 yaw    3.141593 radians

 roll   73.739795 degrees
 pitch -0.000000 degrees
 yaw    180.000000 degrees

to Rotation matrix
   -1.000000   0.000000   0.000000
    0.000000  -0.280000   0.960000
    0.000000   0.960000   0.280000
~~~
